intro: Sonerila gardneri var. firma, commonly known as the firm sonerila, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has elliptical, glossy leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
